key_0.name: Grateful Dead
key_0.set1: Jack Straw, Sugaree, Walkin' Blues, Alabama Getaway*, Me & My Uncle**-> Big River**, Don't Ease Me In (40 mins)
key_0.set2: China Cat Sunflower-> I Know You Rider, Samson & Delilah, If The Shoe Fits, New Speedway Boogie, Estimated Prophet-> Drums-> Space-> I Need A Miracle-> Attics Of My Life-> Johnny B. Goode, E: It's All Over Now Baby Blue (114 mins)
key_0.comment: * First Alabama since 6/18/89** Weir on acoustic, Soundcheck included Alabama Getaway, Attics, Schoolgirl, and It's a Man's World

key_1.name: Grateful Dead
key_1.set1: Bertha, Greatest Story Ever Told, Loser, Little Red Rooster*, Ramble On Rose, El Paso**, Lazy River Road*, Cassidy (57 mins)
key_1.set2: Box Of Rain, Eyes Of The World-> Playin' In The Band-> Uncle John's Band-> Drums-> Space-> The Last Time-> Stella Blue-> Throwing Stones-> Not Fade Away, E: Rain (97 mins)
key_1.comment: * Weir on acoustic, ** Weir on "dobro like" instrument.

key_2.name: Grateful Dead
key_2.set1: Salt Lake City, Friend Of The Devil, Wang Dang Doodle, Tennessee Jed, Broken Arrow, Black Throated Wind*, So Many Roads, The Music Never Stopped (58 mins)
key_2.set2: Foolish Heart, Samba In The Rain, Truckin'-> I I Just Want To Make Love To You To You-> That Would Be Something-> Drums-> Space-> Visions Of Johanna-> Sugar Magnolia, E: Liberty (85 mins)
key_2.comment: * Weir on acoustic, First Salt Lake City. First Want To Make Love To You since 10/8/84, First Visions 4/22/86. Salt Lake City from Weir's solo album Heaven Help the Fool

key_3.name: Grateful Dead
key_3.set1: Help On The Way-> Slipknot!-> Franklin's Tower, The Same Thing, Althea, When I Paint My Masterpiece*, Loose Lucy, Let It Grow
key_3.set2: Scarlet Begonias-> Fire On The Mountain, Way To Go Home-> Saint Of Circumstance-> Corinna-> Drums-> Space-> Visions Of Johanna-> Turn On Your Love Light, E: U.S. Blues

key_4.name: Grateful Dead
key_4.set1: Feel Like A Stranger, Peggy-O, Minglewood Blues, Row Jimmy, Just Like Tom Thumb's Blues, Easy Answers, Deal
key_4.set2: Victim Or The Crime-> New Speedway Boogie-> Looks Like Rain-> Terrapin Station-> Drums-> Space-> The Other One-> Wharf Rat-> One More Saturday Night, E: Lucy In The Sky With Diamonds

key_5.name: Grateful Dead
key_5.set1: Let The Good Times Roll West L.A. Fadeaway Queen Jane Approximately Lazy River Road* Mama Tried** -> Mexicali Blues** Don't Ease Me In**
key_5.set3:
Mardis Gras Parade Before Second Set. * Weir On Acoustic ** Weir On Dobro Like Instrument + W/ David Murray ++ W/ Sikiru On Talking Drum
David Murray And Octofunk Opened.

key_6.name: Grateful Dead
key_6.set1: Here Comes Sunshine, Wang Dang Doodle, Peggy-O, Queen Jane Approximately, Lazy River Road, Eternity*, Loose Lucy (55 mins)
key_6.set2: China Cat Sunflower-> I Know You Rider, Samba In The Rain-> Truckin'-> New Speedway Boogie-> Jam-> Drums-> Space-> All Along The Watchtower-> Standing On the Moon-> Sugar Magnolia, E: Lucy In The Sky With Diamonds (85 mins)
key_6.comment: * Weir on acoustic; Several takes of Unbroken Chain were done for soundcheck/rehearsal.

key_7.name: Grateful Dead
key_7.set1:
Phil Practices Base Line By Himself "it Would Really Help To Have Vinny Here...bob Did You Give That Disc To Steve?" Mostly Dead Air, Drummers Start To Come In Phil, Vince, And Drummers Practice Phil Gives Directions Vince: "let Me Here The Groove Of The Body Of The Song" Phil To Bobby "i Want To Do It In Philadelphia Man" Let's Do The Verses From A-minor C - Take 1 More From The A-minor C - Take 2 Phil: "that Tempo Is Too Fast" Next Take From Same Spot - Take 3 Phil: "if I Have To Go "lookin Fo Famila Fafes"" Take 4 Vince: "is There One Of Those Elevens At The End Of The Threes" Phil Counts Out The Changes Learning The Part After The First Verse Vince: "where In The Bar Are You Starting That Three" Back To The Intro - Take 1 Intro - Take 2 Intro - Take 3 - Phil Explains The Timing Phil Works With Steve On The Tele-prompter "well Then Get Your God Damn Earphones Tunred Up Man" Take 4 Intro - Whole Song Phil Explains Ending Ending - Take 2 What Are The Stumbling Blocks -- Jerry "not Knowing It" Let's Do Something Else For A While Here Comes Sunshine - Take 1 Here Comes Sunshine - Take 2
Total

key_8.name: Grateful Dead
key_8.set1: Hell In A Bucket, West L.A. Fadeaway, El Paso*, Ramble On Rose, Just Like Tom Thumb's Blues, Jack A Roe, Promised Land
key_8.set2: It's All Too Much, Iko Iko, Playin' In The Band-> Uncle John's Band-> Drums-> Space-> The Last Time-> Visions Of Johanna-> One More Saturday Night, E: Rain

key_16.set1:
When a Man Loves a Woman Phil Tuning Banter Schoolgirl (1) Schoolgirl (2) Jerrys ABB Idea * Schoolgirl (3) The ABB Idea Considered * Neighbor Neighbor Hi-Heeled Sneakers Big Boy Pete Big Boy Pete (2) Big Boy Pete (3) Paperback Writer Attics (1) Jerry Complaint Attics (2) Phil Explains to Jerry / Tuning -> Out

key_52.name: Grateful Dead
key_52.set1: Lazy River Road Easy Answers So Many Roads Wave To The Wind Eternity The Days Between Way To Go Home Corinna Liberty
key_52.comment: Studio material from which "last album" would have been prepared.

key_53.name: Grateful Dead
key_53.set1: Lazy River Road Easy Answers So Many Roads Wave To The Wind Eternity The Days Between Way To Go Home Corinna Liberty
key_53.comment: This is a collection of songs which (if the Deadhead's Taping Compendium is to be believed) were to have formed the basis for the first GD studio album of the 1990's. The material appears to be a mix of live SBD recordings (possibly with some minor overdubs) and rehearsals; it's doubtful if any of this represents actual studio recordings aimed at an album release.
